title: How to Put Your Hair up With a Pencil

steps.title: Gather your hair into a ponytail in the center of your head.
steps.content: Gather your hair into a ponytail in the center of your head. Use your hands to gather your hair together in the center of the back of your head. Hold your hair in a ponytail by wrapping your pointer finger over the top and wrapping your thumb under the bottom. [1] X Research source Since you’ll be pushing the sharpened end of the pencil down into the bun, make sure that you hold the ponytail in the center of your head and not below so that the pencil won’t poke you.

steps.title: Wrap your hair around the center to form a bun shape.
steps.content: Wrap your hair around the center to form a bun shape. Using your free hand, wrap your hair around the center base where your other hand is holding the ponytail in place to create a bun shape. Remove the hand that’s holding the ponytail once you’ve wrapped your hair around once or twice, or enough times that it stays in place, then continue wrapping. Tuck the end underneath the bun, then place one of your hands over the bun to hold it in place. [2] X Research source If you want the bun to be tighter, you can first hold the ponytail out straight and twist the hair a few times before wrapping it around the base into the bun.

steps.title: Push a pencil into the bun and weave it up and down.
steps.content: Push a pencil into the bun and weave it up and down. First, take your pencil and place the sharpened end just to the left or right of the center of the top of the bun. Then, insert it into the bun on either the left or right side, angling down. Weave the pencil up and down as you push it through the middle of the bun. Keep weaving and pushing the pencil through until it comes out the other end of the bun. [3] X Research source You can push the pencil further in or pull it out a bit to adjust it so it sticks out evenly on either side of the bun.

steps.title: Tuck in any loose hairs if you want a clean, sleek bun.
steps.content: Tuck in any loose hairs if you want a clean, sleek bun. Take any loose hairs that you want tucked away and wrap them around the base of the bun. Then, push the ends of the loose hairs up under the hair at the base of the bun to hold it in place. [4] X Research source If you’re going for a more relaxed pencil bun look, you can leave the loose hairs out and skip this step. You can also use a bobby pin to secure any loose ends in place.

steps.title: Gather your hair into a low ponytail.
steps.content: Gather your hair into a low ponytail. Use your hands to gather your hair together in the bottom center of the back of your head, right at the nape of your neck. Then, hold your hair in a ponytail by creating a loop around your hair with your pointer finger wrapped over the top and your thumb wrapped under the bottom. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Wrap your hair around the pencil.
steps.content: Wrap your hair around the pencil. First, hold the pencil on the left side of the ponytail horizontally with the sharp end pointing in towards your ponytail. Then, wrap your hair up over and around the pencil once or twice until only the ends are left unwrapped. [6] X Research source If your hair is more of a medium length, you’ll likely only need to wrap it around the pencil once. If your hair is longer, you may need to wrap it around twice. If you want your bun to be a bit messier , you can leave more of your hair unwrapped so it’ll stick out of the bun a bit more.

steps.title: Rotate the pencil so the point is facing straight down.
steps.content: Rotate the pencil so the point is facing straight down. Once only the end of your hair is left unwrapped, rotate the pencil clockwise until the eraser of the pencil is in the center of your head and the sharpened end is pointing down. [7] X Research source The sharpened end of the pencil will naturally start pushing down into the bun as you rotate it clockwise.

steps.title: Push the pencil down into the twisted hair until it holds in place.
steps.content: Push the pencil down into the twisted hair until it holds in place. Once the pencil is vertical and sticking straight down, push the pencil down slowly through the twist until the bun holds in place. [8] X Research source Because the pencil will already have started pushing down into the bun when you rotated it, you’ll likely only need to push it down about 1 inch (2.5 cm) to get it to hold in place. Make sure that you stop pushing the pencil down before it comes out the bottom to keep it from poking you in the neck. While an inverted pencil bun is generally worn more relaxed and messy, you can use bobby pins to secure any loose hairs in place if you want a cleaner look. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Gather your hair into a low ponytail in the center of your head.
steps.content: Gather your hair into a low ponytail in the center of your head. Use your hands to gather your hair together at the bottom of the center of the back of your head, just above the nape of your neck. Then, create a loop with your pointer finger and thumb to hold your hair in a ponytail. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Wrap your hair around 2 horizontal pencils.
steps.content: Wrap your hair around 2 horizontal pencils. First, hold 2 pencils horizontally just below the ponytail at the nape of your neck. Hold them so the eraser end is on the left side of your head and the sharpened end is pointing to the right. Then, wrap the ponytail up over and around the pencils twice until the hair feels securely wrapped. [11] X Research source You can also use chopsticks instead of pencils. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Rotate the pencils up and slide them down to secure the style.
steps.content: Rotate the pencils up and slide them down to secure the style. Rotate the pencils up clockwise by pushing the eraser ends up towards the top of your head. Once the eraser ends are in the center and the pencils are vertical, push the pencils down into the bun, angling towards your scalp to gather more hair. Once the pencils stick out the bottom, your bun will be secure. [13] X Research source You can push the pencils straight down for a more uniform look, or rotate them a bit in opposite directions as you push down into the bun at an inward angle.

steps.title: Braid
steps.content: Braid your hair into a basic 3-strand braid. First, separate your hair into 3 equal-sized sections. Then, braid your hair into a low basic braid, right above the nape of your neck. Secure the braid with a hair tie to hold it in place. [14] X Research source If you want your braided bun to be tighter, put your hair into a ponytail first and secure it with a hair tie. Then, braid the ponytail and secure the end with another hair tie before moving on to the next step. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Roll the braid into a coil towards your head.
steps.content: Roll the braid into a coil towards your head. Grab ahold of the end of the braid and hold it up vertically. Then, start rolling the braid in towards your head by tucking the end of the braid in on top of the braid and coiling inward until the whole braid is rolled up at your head. [16] X Research source Rolling the braid in towards your head from the end will hide the hair tie within the pencil bun.

steps.title: Stick your pencil up into the braid, then rotate it down.
steps.content: Stick your pencil up into the braid, then rotate it down. First, push the pencil into the braid, angling upward to gather the hair. Stop pushing once the pencil reaches your scalp at the top. Then, rotate the pencil clockwise to secure your hair in place. Once you can’t rotate anymore, push the pencil into the braid a bit more to secure the bun. [17] X Research source Depending on how tightly your hair is braided, you may be able to rotate the bun until the pencil is vertical with the sharpened end straight down, or you may only be able to rotate a bit. Both options will hold securely in place and look great.
